segments.text: The sight of the woman so focused on her dishwashing is almost surreal in this chaotic scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a wave of frustration for her as she remains unaware of the mess forming underneath her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn’t see the water spilling over; she doesn’t hear the sounds of the impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she be so oblivious when everything around her is in disarray?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s as if she’s trapped in her bubble of domesticity, blind to the chaos emerging.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are getting bolder, and I can't help but feel mad at how they are sneaking away with the cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their youthful energy feels reckless, and it makes me want to intervene, to save them from potential harm.
segments.speaker: PAR
